line_1: To pace the corn-field's grassy edge
line_2: Close by a fresh-blown sweet-bri'r hedge

line_1: Pluck the pale primrose bending from its edge,
line_2: Or tittering dance amid the whispering sedge. —

line_1: And never lip that press'd its homely edge
line_2: Had kinder blessings or a heartier pledge.
